DOC.brief_summary: This pilot clinical trial study culturally-informed counsel intervention Latinas high risk hereditary breast ovarian cancer . A culturally-informed counseling intervention may effective method help people learn cancer risk .
DOC.brief_title: Culturally-Informed Counseling Latinas High Risk Hereditary Breast Ovarian Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To conduct randomized trial culturally-informed pre-genetic cancer risk assessment ( GCRA ) telephone intervention . II . To evaluate effect pre-GCRA intervention versus time attention control versus standard schedule procedure alone ( usual care ) level anxiety , perceive personal control cancer genetics knowledge . III . To explore patient ' experience pre-GCRA intervention post-intervention telephone interview . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To explore patient ' perceived barrier GCRA no-show telephone interview . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 3 treatment arm . ARM I : Patients receive culturally-informed adapted motivational interview telephone call . ARM II : Patients participate control condition comprise health habit intervention group . ARM III : Patients receive usual care comprise standard schedule phone call proceed normal GCRA process . All patient mail standard new patient packet contain questionnaire demographic personal health history , family history form . All patient undergo genetic cancer risk assessment .
DOC.criteria: Individuals personal history hereditary breast ovarian cancer ; subset 60 woman without personal history hereditary ovarian cancer include exploratory subset analysis Meet NCCN criterion consideration genetic test hereditary breast cancer Willing sign consent Pregnant woman woman childbearing potential eligible participation study Women report Latino Hispanic ethnic background ( defined Spanish , Mexican , Central South American , Cuban , Puerto Rican , Dominican , Hispanic origin ) Women uninsured come lowincome community Ability understand English Spanish Previous participation GCRA
